credit.name: Institute for Research in Biomedicine Barcelona

publication.abstract: More than 1700 trajectories of proteins representative of monomeric soluble structures in the protein data bank (PDB) have been obtained by means of state-of-the-art atomistic molecular dynamics simulations in near-physiological conditions. The trajectories and analyses are stored in a large data warehouse, which can be queried for dynamic information on proteins, including interactions. Here, we describe the project and the structure and contents of our database, and provide examples of how it can be used to describe the global flexibility properties of proteins. Basic analyses and trajectories stripped of solvent molecules at a reduced resolution level are available from our web server. Â© 2010 Elsevier Ltd.
publication.title: MoDEL (Molecular Dynamics Extended Library): A Database of Atomistic Molecular Dynamics Trajectories

summary.description: Database of protein Molecular Dynamics simulations, with 1800 trajectories representing different structural clusters of the PDB.
summary.name: MoDEL
